document_title: Penile cancer: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Penile cancer occurs when cells grow out of control outside or in a man's penis. The disease often starts from skin cells, but "seeds" can also appear inside the penis. (first)
Penile cancer is rare, but if detected early, it can be completely treated.
Penile cancer is divided into the following types:
1. Squamous cell carcinoma
Squamous cell carcinoma accounts for 95% of penile cancer cases. The disease often appears in the outermost layer of skin, so it is called carcinoma. However, the disease can also progress in other parts of the penis.
2. Basal cell carcinoma
In contrast to squamous cell carcinoma, basal cell carcinoma occurs in the final layer of the epithelium. The characteristic of this form of cancer is that it grows slowly and is unable to spread to other areas of the body.
3. Melanoma
It is a form of cancer that begins in the cells that give skin its color, also called melanocytes.
4. Sarcoma
Sarcoma is a term used to describe cancers that start in bones and soft tissues. For penile cancer, signs form in tissues such as blood vessels, muscle and fat.
subsection_title: ung thu duong vat.json. What is penile cancer?
